title: Jocuserious
author: Jocuserious
content: You can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe.

comments.author: nimogsm
comments.body: I also don’t see any point in this since the risk of blocking is simply huge. If there are bonuses in the form of a referral program, then it is better to ask a friend to make an account and receive deductions and bonuses on it this does not violate the rules. The best strategy is to be honest from the very beginning, then no blockages are scary.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. Yes, you can, if the casino has no terms against multiple accounts.No, you can't if the casino terms say one account allowed per person or per household or something like that.So the answer depends on which casino you are playing with, if you don't know whether the casino allows multiple accounts then you must have skipped the ToS reading part while agreeing to it.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: What that is most important is to read the casino TOS. From the TOS you will see if a gambling site customers can have more than one account or not. But what I have noticed is that all the casinos that I have read their TOS only allow one account.Some people can be dubious and want to get more deposit bonus and register many accounts. If such person is known, the account can be banned. And in some cases that the user may not know about it and if he do not do anything dubious, the gambling site will merge both accounts into a single account.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. You are right, for the most of casinos out there on the internet and those which are properly registered. However, it mostly depends on the Terms of Service of the Casino. I have personally checked the ToS of some shady casino, which is quite infamous here on the forum, and for some reason, they allow people (or rather victims) to have multiple accounts in the casino.Since most of the reputable casinos only allow one account per users, I would consider casinos which allow more than account to be slightly suspicious, in my opinion. If one want to have more than a an account is better just to check out with customer service and ask whether it is allowed or not. Better safe than sorry.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Quote from: jrrsparkles on September 20, 2023, 05:56:34 PMQuote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. Yes, you can, if the casino has no terms against multiple accounts.No, you can't if the casino terms say one account allowed per person or per household or something like that.So the answer depends on which casino you are playing with, if you don't know whether the casino allows multiple accounts then you must have skipped the ToS reading part while agreeing to it.I guess online majority of online casinos are against multiple accounts and it could be used against you. If you look at the scam accusations or at least some of them. The first problem that the casino might throw into your face is that you might be suspected of cheating by having multiple accounts.So for me, it's better not to try this, it's like in land based casino's wherein you have a lot of ids when you join them to have some perks. So it's better to just have one and have one real account.

comments.author: Aikidoka
comments.body: I agree, it seems strange to have two accounts for gambling. I believe one account should be okay and I can't think of a valid reason to create two accounts for gambling tbh.The only scenario I can see where multiple accounts could be created is if a casino accepts only fiat and requires no KYC verification. However, if the casino exclusively deals only with fiat then you cant' do that. There might be some rare situations where someone considers creating multiple accounts for selling purposes but that would indeed be so strange IMO.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. You ask a question in the subject of your thread, then straight away answer the question in the body of the thread, why bother asking when you already know your answer ?Anyways, I think this is something most gamblers already know, i personally do not think we have any newbie gamblers on this board who do not know that multi accounting on a gambling casino is a big offence which could lead to a ban when caught or discovered by the casino .

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. In your previous thread I pointed out the same thing, you are fond of creating a thread in which the title will have a question but when it’s opened and we start reading we’ll discover that you have already provided the answer. You really should learn how to create thread title and stop misleading people with the title of your threads. Now back to your post, the ToS of all casinos are not the same they’re are some that forbid people to have more than one account due to the fact that they can use it to abuse bonuses that are given out to new accounts while they are some that do tolerate it (it’s not common to find such casino tho).. it all depends on the terms of the casino.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. Some casinos look away from that,  but then you still stand the risk of losing your accounts ad all the money in them,  I am sure there is no other reason to have multiple accounts on a casino unless to abuse welcome bonuses so casinos already are aware of this and that is why,  those casinos that look away from multiple accounting doesn't offer any form of bonus to the new client's. And more also if the casino is KYC it will not be allowed or impossible to operate multiple accounts since you may not be able to verify all of them with the same documents.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: It's not unusual to have multiple accounts in a casino though. Casinos wouldn't mind as they will be asking your KYC upon withdrawing a big amount. If all your accounts not withdrawing money they think too big, the casino may never know.But we have seen it several times in the forum where a casino is accusing abuses from users of repeatedly taking advantage of these bonuses. Bookmakers are not allowing it because bettors are usually cheating using multiple accounts for match betting.

comments.author: alastantiger
comments.body: The answer to your question of whether an individual can have multiple accounts at the same casino is no. Here is a typical example of it. If you check the Service board you will see that in MegaPari review, one of the reviews who already had an account created a new one and the manager told him that, he cannot have more than one account because it is against the terms and conditions of the casino. Besides what could be the reason why a person would have more than one account.

comments.author: Huppercase
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. Are you giving advice or you are warning users thag practice such? I don't think there is any reason to have multiple accounts in a casino and betting platforms because first, it's against there rules and regulations, I don't think there is really a casino out there that suppurt such behavior, it's like hiding behind two face to make money from the companies, often times that accounts were suspended here is as a result of the multiple accounts that's why they banned or restricted the accounts and when they can't verify or withdraw, they cry for help that they have been scammed by the casino.Another reason why it's bad to use two accounts is KYC, most of the casinos request for KYC if they see that your account is suspicious or related with other account in activity, such thing can make them request for KYC but they will first suspend the account and if you don't verify the account, you will lose everything both in the accounts, it's better to risk everything you have in one account.

comments.author: topbitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. You didn't specify which gambling platform you were referring to. Indeed, there are some gambling platforms that only allow one account for one user. And indeed there are platforms that allow this, but in my opinion, why should we have multiple accounts on the same gambling platform where this is pointless. And I've never seen anyone do anything as ridiculous as this. Meanwhile, for those who have many gambling accounts, their accounts are registered on various gambling platforms, not just one platform. And they do this to seek their luck to find out which gambling sites can give them big wins when gambling. And as for other reasons, they do this to find which gambling platform they feel is the safest and most comfortable, which behaves in a sporting manner and does not delay balance withdrawals when we get big profits from gambling and the bets we win.

comments.author: famososMuertos
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. Can you breathe on planet Earth?It is an ambiguous question, although its answer seems elementary, if you are human, it is directly yes.Any casino player, that is, a human knows that it is not allowed to have two accounts, no.Unless you are a fish, and literally for what it means in the world of betting and you do it in a casino that allows it, which must be equivalent to what it means to live in the water, that is, only fish go there. If you want to understand me more, look up what "fish" means in betting jargon.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: There are a few casinos that don't care. Bustadice is 1 that multiple accounts doesn't matter. I think most casinos that are against it are casinos that have a bonus system. They do not want abusers being able to abuse their bonus system on multiple accounts. As I have already read, it depends on the ToS. This is a perfect answer.

comments.author: kawetsriyanto
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. Indeed. Most casinos won't allow the members to have multiple accounts. There is no advantage to have more than 1 account in 1 casino site. I think it only leads us to spend excessive money on the casino sites. Anyway, it is not only about our personal data, the casino can know our IP address. When they detect we use the same IP in more than 1 account, our accounts can be banned. It will be very bad when we leave some money on the casino account, we probably can't withdraw it if we can't access it anymore. So, it is better to avoid making more than 1 account. It just harms us!

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: Based on the terms of the gambling sites, users can have multiple accounts. As said casinos providing bonus doesn't allow it, as the multiple accounts will receive bonus. This is an additional spending for the gambling platform. Most of the time to get the welcome bonus people used to create multiple accounts without knowing that those funds can't be withdrawn without fulfilling the wagering requirements and other deposit conditions.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. You have to read the TOS of that site, and I think someone is doing this especially if there’s no KYC needed and having a multiple account doesn’t mean cheating, maybe that gambler just want to try a different account with a hope of a better luck. Again, this will only become illegal if the terms prohibit it. Though if you don’t want to worry about this problem in the future, then you can stick with your sole account and continue to gambling, having multiple account still not guarantee a profit so think again.

comments.author: goldkingcoiner
comments.body: Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 05:26:06 PMYou can't. Because your account contains your personal and banking information and the casino allows only one customer account registration to ensure your security. So it is foolish to try this because it may get your account banned so you should use an account to keep your fund safe. That all depends on whether or not the casino that you mentioned allows that. You can go to the terms and service of that casino by scrolling down to the bottom of the website and clicking on "Terms and Conditions" or "Terms of Service". Sometimes the naming can be a bit off, but they are usually very similar to each other. Although similar does not mean exactly the same. Nor should you misunderstand it as such.Read it through carefully and be sure not to break any rules, otherwise your account and your funds could be in danger of being frozen/confiscated, depending on the transgression, of course.
